    - Performance of Demand Paging

    • Page Fault Rate : 0 â‰¤ p â‰¤ 1
      • p == 0 : no page fault
      • p == 1 : ëª¨ë“  reference ëŠ” fault

    • Effective Access Time (EAT, ìœ íš¨ ì—‘ì„¸ìŠ¤ ì‹œê°„)

        EAT = = (Page Hit Rate) * (Memory Acess Time) + (Page Fault Rate) * (Page Fault Service Time)
  			= (1-p) * (Memory Access Time) + p * ((page fault overhead) + (swap page out) + (swap page in) + (restart overhead))

    [Demand Paging Example]

    - Memory access time = 200 nanoseconds = 200 * 10^-6 sec
- Average page-fault service time = 8 milliseconds = 8 * 10^-3 sec

EAT = (1 â€“ p) x 200 + p (8 milliseconds)
		= (1 â€“ p)  x 200 + p x 8,000,000
		= 200 + p x 7,999,800
    • p = 0.001 ì´ë¼ë©´ EAT = 8.2 ms ê°€ ë˜ê³  ì´ëŠ” 40% ì˜ ì„±ëŠ¥ ì €í•˜ë¥¼ ë°œìƒ
    • ì„±ëŠ¥ ì €í•˜(performance degradation) ê°€ 10% ë¯¸ë§Œì´ê¸¸ ì›í•œë‹¤ë©´
      • 220 > 220 + 7999800 * p â†’ 20 > 7999800 * p â†’ p < 0.0000025 ì´ì–´ì•¼í•¨
      • ì¦‰ 400000 ë²ˆì— í•œë²ˆ page fault ê°€ ë°œìƒí•´ì•¼í•¨

      | Ref String | Mem | Page Fault? | | â€” | â€” | â€” | | 1 | [1] | init | | 2 | [1 2] | init | | 3 | [1 2 3] | init | | 4 | [4 2 3] | 1 out | | 1 | [4 1 3] | 2 out | | 2 | [4 1 2] | 3 out | | 5 | [5 1 2] | 4 out | | 1 | [5 1 2] | | | 2 | [5 1 2] | | | 3 | [5 3 2] | 1 out â†’ ref ìˆœì„œê°€ ì•„ë‹ˆë¼ memì— ë“¤ì–´ì˜¨ ìˆœì„œ | | 4 | [5 3 4] | 2 out | | 5 | [5 3 4] | |

    - Least Recently Used (LRU) Algorithm

    • ê°€ì¥ ì˜¤ë˜ ë™ì•ˆ ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ì§€ ì•Šì€ page ë¥¼ victim ìœ¼ë¡œ ê³ ë¦„ â†’ memory ì˜ temporal locality ì†ì„±ì„ ì‚¬ìš©í•œ ë°©ë²•

    • 2ê°€ì§€ allocation schemes
      1. Fixed Allocation
      2. Priority Allocation

    - Fixed Allocatioin

    • ê³ ì •ëœ ìˆ˜ì˜ frame ì„ í• ë‹¹í•˜ëŠ”ë° ì´ë•Œ ê· ë“±í•˜ê²Œ í• ë‹¹í•˜ëƒ, ë¹„ë¡€í•˜ê²Œ í• ë‹¹í•˜ëƒì— ë”°ë¼ì„œ ë‚˜ë‰¨
      1. Equal Allocation
      • process ì—ê²Œ ë™ì¼í•œ ìˆ˜ì˜ frame í• ë‹¹
      • ex) 5ê°œì˜ processê°€ ìˆê³  100 frame ì´ ìˆì„ ë•Œ ê° Process ë§ˆë‹¤ 20 frame ì”© í• ë‹¹
        1. Proportional Allocation
      • process ì˜ size ì— ë¹„ë¡€í•˜ê²Œ frame í• ë‹¹ â†’ ì¦‰ ê° processê°€ ì–¼ë§ˆë‚˜ need í•˜ëŠ”ì§€ë¥¼ ê¸°ë°˜ìœ¼ë¡œ ë¶„ë°°
      • s_i = size of process p_i
      • S = âˆ‘ s_i
      • m = total number of frames
      • a_i = allocation for p_i = (s_i/S) * m

      • ex) m = 64, s_1 = 10, s_2 = 127

        â†’ a_1 = (10/137) * 64 = 5, a_2 = (127/137) * 64 = 59

    - Prioirty Allocation

    • size ëŒ€ì‹  priority ì— ë”°ë¼ ë¹„ë¡€ì ìœ¼ë¡œ ë¶„ë°°í•˜ëŠ” Proportional Allocation

    - Keeping Track of the Working Set

    [Example ğš« = 10,000 ]

    - Page-Fault Frequency Schme
